title: Flaws Make Heroes: The Power of Imperfection
description: A quick, practical guide to Flaws Make Heroes: The Power of Imperfection.

hook.text: Superman is boring. Batman is fascinating. The difference? Batman is broken â€” brokenness beats perfection every time.

buildup.text: Character flaws create internal conflict, drive mistakes, and force growth.

discovery.text: Aristotle called this 'hamartia' â€” the fatal flaw that makes a hero relatable AND vulnerable.

twist.text: The flaw should be the flip side of the character's greatest strength. Sherlock's brilliance makes him arrogant.

climax.text: The best character arcs show the flaw being confronted, not necessarily fixed. Walter White's flaw intensifies.

punchline.text: Perfect characters bore readers. Broken ones make them lean in.

quiz.question: What did Aristotle call the hero's fatal flaw?
